title: 112_s1358
content: The "Parental Bereavement Act of 2011" allows for family leave in the event of the death of a son or daughter. The "Parental Bereavement Act of 2011" permits family leave for the death of a son or daughter, with specific requirements for scheduling and substitution of paid leave. Amendments are made to the "Parental Bereavement Act of 2011" regarding notice requirements for leave due to the death of a son or daughter, spouses employed by the same employer, and certification requirements. Amendments to the "Parental Bereavement Act of 2011" include certification requirements for leave related to the death of a son or daughter. An employer may request certification for such leave, and the employee must provide it in a timely manner. The amendments to the "Parental Bereavement Act of 2011" now include certification requirements for leave related to the death of an employee's son or daughter. The certification must meet the Secretary's regulations and be provided in a timely manner. The "Parental Bereavement Act of 2011" now includes certification requirements for leave related to the death of an employee, with specific provisions for employees unable to return to work due to a specified death. The "Parental Bereavement Act of 2011" includes amendments to entitlements for family leave for civil service employees under title 5, United States Code. Amendments include specifying exceptions for leave under section 102(a)(1)(F) and updating references in subsection (d) to include paragraphs (2) and (4) of section 102(e). The "Parental Bereavement Act of 2011" amends entitlements for family leave for civil service employees under title 5, United States Code. It includes exceptions for leave due to the death of a son or daughter, requirements for leave scheduling, substitution of paid leave, and notice provisions. The "Parental Bereavement Act of 2011" amends entitlements for family leave for civil service employees under title 5, United States Code by adding a new paragraph requiring employees to provide notice for foreseeable leave. Additionally, certification requirements for leave requests under a specific subsection are outlined, with the employee mandated to provide the employer with a copy of the certification in a timely manner.
